name: Ab Wheel
instructions: Kneel on the floor and grip the ab wheel handles with both hands.
Position the wheel on the floor in front of you with arms extended.
Engage your core and slowly roll the wheel forward, extending your body.
Roll out as far as you can while maintaining a straight back and tight core.
Pause briefly at full extension.
Use your core muscles to pull yourself back to the starting position.

name: Aerobics
instructions: Choose your preferred aerobic activity (running, cycling, dancing, etc.).
Start with a light warm-up for 5 minutes.
Gradually increase intensity to your target heart rate zone.
Maintain consistent movement for your desired duration (20-60 minutes).
Cool down with 5 minutes of light activity and stretching.

name: Arnold Press
instructions: Sit on a bench with back support, holding dumbbells at shoulder height.
Start with palms facing toward you, elbows bent.
Press the dumbbells up while rotating your wrists outward.
End with palms facing forward and arms fully extended overhead.
Pause briefly at the top of the movement.
Reverse the motion, rotating palms back toward you as you lower.
Control the weight back to the starting position.

name: Around the World
instructions: Lie on a flat bench holding a dumbbell with both hands directly above your chest.
Keep a slight bend in your elbows throughout the movement.
Lower the weight in an arc motion over and around your head.
Continue the circular motion, bringing the weight down toward your hips.
Complete the circle by bringing the weight back to starting position.
Repeat in the opposite direction.

name: Back Extension
instructions: Position yourself with proper posture and grip the handles or bar.
Engage your core and keep your back straight.
Pull the weight toward your body, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Control the weight as you return to the starting position.
Focus on using your back muscles, not just your arms.
Complete the desired number of repetitions.

name: Back Extension (Machine)
instructions: Position yourself with proper posture and grip the handles or bar.
Engage your core and keep your back straight.
Pull the weight toward your body, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Control the weight as you return to the starting position.
Focus on using your back muscles, not just your arms.
Complete the desired number of repetitions.

name: Ball Slams
instructions: Position yourself in the starting position with proper form.
Engage your core muscles and maintain a neutral spine.
Perform the movement with control, focusing on your core.
Breathe steadily throughout the exercise.
Hold or move through the full range of motion.
Return to starting position and repeat.

name: Barbell Bench Press
instructions: Position yourself on the bench or in starting position.
Grip the handles or weights firmly with proper hand placement.
Lower the weight in a controlled motion, feeling the stretch in your chest.
Press the weight back up, squeezing your chest muscles at the top.
Maintain control throughout the entire range of motion.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Barbell Curl
instructions: Position yourself properly for the exercise with correct form.
Engage your core and maintain proper posture throughout.
Perform the movement in a slow and controlled manner.
Focus on the target muscle group and maintain tension.
Complete the desired number of repetitions.
Rest adequately between sets.

name: Barbell Deadlift
instructions: Position yourself with proper posture and grip the handles or bar.
Engage your core and keep your back straight.
Pull the weight toward your body, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Control the weight as you return to the starting position.

name: Bench Press
instructions: Lie flat on a bench with feet planted firmly on the ground.
Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Unrack the bar and hold it directly above your chest with arms extended.
Lower the bar slowly to your mid-chest, keeping elbows at a 45-degree angle.
Pause briefly when the bar touches your chest.
Press the bar back up powerfully to the starting position.
Fully extend your arms at the top while maintaining tension.

name: Deadlift
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, barbell over mid-foot.
Bend at hips and knees to grip the bar with hands just outside your legs.
Keep your back straight, chest up, and shoulders back.
Engage your core and drive through your heels to lift the bar.
Extend your hips and knees simultaneously as you stand up.
Keep the bar close to your body throughout the movement.
Lower the bar by pushing your hips back and bending your knees.

name: Decline Bench Press
instructions: Position yourself on the bench or in starting position.

name: Lunge
instructions: Stand upright with feet hip-width apart.
Step forward with one leg, maintaining an upright torso.
Lower your body until both knees are bent at 90-degree angles.
Your back knee should hover just above the ground.
Keep your front knee aligned over your ankle.
Push through your front heel to return to starting position.
Repeat on the opposite leg.

name: Mountain Climbers
instructions: Position yourself properly for the exercise with correct form.
Engage your core and maintain proper posture throughout.

name: Pull Up
instructions: Hang from a pull-up bar with hands shoulder-width apart, palms facing away.
Start from a dead hang with arms fully extended.
Engage your back and pull your body up by driving elbows down.
Continue pulling until your chin is above the bar.
Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top.
Lower yourself in a controlled manner back to the starting position.
Maintain control and avoid swinging or using momentum.

name: Push Press
instructions: Stand or sit with proper posture and core engaged.
Hold the weight(s) at the starting position.
Press or lift the weight in a controlled motion.
Squeeze your shoulder muscles at the peak of the movement.
Lower the weight with control to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Push Up
instructions: Start in a plank position with hands shoulder-width apart.
Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels.
Engage your core throughout the entire movement.
Lower your body by bending your elbows until chest nearly touches the floor.
Keep elbows at about a 45-degree angle from your body.
Push through your palms to return to starting position.
Fully extend arms while maintaining core tension.

name: Reverse Crunch
instructions: Position yourself properly for the exercise with correct form.
Engage your core and maintain proper posture throughout.
Perform the movement in a slow and controlled manner.
Focus on the target muscle group and maintain tension.

Focus on using your back muscles, not just your arms.
Complete the desired number of repetitions.

instructions: Position yourself properly for the exercise with correct form.
Engage your core and maintain proper posture throughout.
Perform the movement in a slow and controlled manner.
Focus on the target muscle group and maintain tension.
Complete the desired number of repetitions.
Rest adequately between sets.

name: Shoulder Press Machine
instructions: Stand or sit with proper posture and core engaged.
Hold the weight(s) at the starting position.
Press or lift the weight in a controlled motion.
Squeeze your shoulder muscles at the peak of the movement.
Lower the weight with control to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Side Plank
instructions: Position yourself in the starting position with proper form.
Engage your core muscles and maintain a neutral spine.
Perform the movement with control, focusing on your core.
Breathe steadily throughout the exercise.
Hold or move through the full range of motion.
Return to starting position and repeat.

name: Smith Machine Bench Press
instructions: Position yourself on the bench or in starting position.
Grip the handles or weights firmly with proper hand placement.

Press the weight back up, squeezing your chest muscles at the top.
Maintain control throughout the entire range of motion.

name: Squat
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly pointed out.
Keep your chest up, core engaged, and back straight.
Bend at the hips and knees simultaneously to lower your body.
Descend until thighs are at least parallel to the ground.
Keep your knees tracking over your toes, not caving inward.
Push through your heels to return to standing position.
Fully extend hips and knees at the top.
